net.sf.wubiq.utils

Class BaseProperties

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.wubiq.utils.BaseProperties
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ServerProperties

    public abstract class BaseProperties
extends java.lang.Object
    Collects the value from properties. This file search is as followed. It is first searched in the folder in the system file where the client is run. If not found then it is look up in the default paths of java class paths.
    Author:
    Federico Alcantara

        public java.lang.Integer getConnectionRetries()
        A value indicating the number of times to keep trying to connect before aborting client.
        Returns:
        Connection retries count.

      • getConnections

        public java.lang.String getConnections()
        Reads the possible connections from the client properties. This should be the preferred method.
        Returns:
        A comma separated list of connections.

      • isDebugMode

        public boolean isDebugMode()
        If true the debug mode is enabled (verbosed).
        Returns:
        Debug mode.

      • getDebugLogLevel

        public java.lang.Integer getDebugLogLevel()
        The level to use for log output.
        Returns:
        Integer value between 0 - 5.

      • getPollInterval

        public java.lang.Integer getPollInterval()
        Gets the interval for polling the server about pending jobs.
        Returns:
        Integer with the value. Never null.

      • getPrintJobWait

        public java.lang.Integer getPrintJobWait()
        Gets the print job wait value. This is the time (in milliseconds) to wait after a successful print job handling.
        Returns:
        Integer with the value. Never null.

      • getInt

                                java.lang.Integer defaultValue)
        Gets an integer value out of a property.
        Parameters:
        key - Key for the property.
        defaultValue - Default value to use.
        Returns:
        Property value as string.

      • get

        protected java.lang.String get(java.lang.String key,
                               java.lang.String defaultValue)
        Gets a value from properties file.
        Parameters:
        key - Key to search for.
        defaultValue - Value to return in case key is not found in properties.
        Returns:
        Found value or default value.

      • getProperties

        protected java.util.Properties getProperties()
        Reads property file.
        Parameters:
        reload - If true reloads the file.
        Returns:
        Properties according to the file contents.

      • getPropertiesFile

        protected java.io.File getPropertiesFile(java.lang.String filePrefix)
        Reads property file.
        Parameters:
        reload - If true reloads the file.
        Returns:
        Properties according to file contents.

      • getPropertiesFile

        protected abstract java.io.File getPropertiesFile()
        Must produce a file where the properties reside. Should return null if not found.
        Returns:
        Found file or null.

      • showPropertiesFileFound

        protected abstract void showPropertiesFileFound()
        Shows a message indicating that a properties file was found.

      • showPropertiesFileNotFound

        protected abstract void showPropertiesFileNotFound()
        Shows a message indicating that the properties file was not found.

      • showPropertiesFound

        protected abstract void showPropertiesFound()
        Shows a message indicating that a properties element was found. This might be a different message, since the properties file might be inside a jar object.

      • showPropertiesNotFound

        protected abstract void showPropertiesNotFound()
        Shows a message indicating that a properties element was not found. This might be a different message, since the properties file might be inside a jar object.
